body:
This is similar to #6154 but a different side effect. The same package ends up built several times:

~~~
-- linux-centos6-x86_64 / intel@2018.0.128.7.2.0 ----------------
52peacb intel-mkl@2018.0.128%intel cflags="-O3 -fPIC -xHost" cxxflags="-O3 -fPIC -xHost" fflags="-O3 -fPIC -xHost" ~ilp64+shared threads=none
j3iyr6z intel-mkl@2018.0.128%intel cflags="-O3 -xHost -fPIC" cxxflags="-O3 -xHost -fPIC" fflags="-O3 -xHost -fPIC" ~ilp64+shared threads=none
afapivc intel-mkl@2018.0.128%intel cflags="-fPIC -O3 -xHost" cxxflags="-fPIC -O3 -xHost" fflags="-fPIC -O3 -xHost" ~ilp64+shared threads=none
6k4nhxs intel-mkl@2018.0.128%intel cflags="-fPIC -xHost -O3" cxxflags="-fPIC -xHost -O3" fflags="-fPIC -xHost -O3" ~ilp64+shared threads=none
eyc6uke intel-mkl@2018.0.128%intel cflags="-xHost -O3 -fPIC" cxxflags="-xHost -O3 -fPIC" fflags="-xHost -O3 -fPIC" ~ilp64+shared threads=none
shia23h intel-mkl@2018.0.128%intel cflags="-xHost -fPIC -O3" cxxflags="-xHost -fPIC -O3" fflags="-xHost -fPIC -O3" ~ilp64+shared threads=none
~~~
title: spack reorders compiler flags and repeatedly builds the same package
